page.title: 15CRAFTS/PAST & PRESENT -ARRAN
page.content: Situated at Rosaburn, Brodick, is the Heritage Museum. There is a working smiddy, an old Arran Cottage, a coach house with geological, archaeological and shipping displays, old agriculture implements and the school's heritage project. Attractions this season were displays of lace-making, spinning, weaving and horseshoeing. Though man has advanced greatly through the invention of new machinery and materials some of the island's population have chosen to come here and pursue what might be described as the old crafts - spinning, weaving, knitting, basketry, pottery, wood-carving etc. The Art and Craft industry in Brodick is thriving with a shop opening recently in Glasgow and some local craftsmen exporting to other parts of the world.
